## CES-D vs MAAS

Comparing questionnaires often presents a challenge in psychology research, due to the magnitude and complexity of harmonising correlating items. This issue is particularly relevant when comparing well-known instruments like the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression (CES-D) and the Maternal Antenatal Attachment Scale (MAAS). Harmony, a software developed specifically for psychologists and social scientists, addresses this challenge, allowing for the efficient and reliable evaluation of correlation between item sets, ensuring that CES-D vs MAAS comparisons are accurate and meaningful. Harmony streamlines the harmonisation process through its intelligent use of natural language processing and generative AI models. This technology enables researchers to directly compare items within CES-D and MAAS, giving a percentage match of similarity. Its user-friendly interface offers a drag and drop feature, where one could add questionnaire instruments in the forms of PDFs and run the comparison. The CES-D vs MAAS comparison can be performed in multiple languages, further demonstrating Harmony's adaptable functionality. Investing your time in CES-D vs MAAS comparisons delivers deeper insights across both intra and inter-study spectrums. This is especially beneficial when conducting longitudinal research and when seeking to confirm results or note dissimilarities arising from changing societal conditions. Save your research time with Harmony, ensuring the correlations drawn in CES-D vs MAAS comparison hold a high level of credibility while minimizing the human error factor. The power of sophisticated AI is there to assist psychologists and social scientists in integrating data and generating meaningful outcomes.

## Compare the items in CES-D English and MAAS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and MAAS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just MAAS into Harmony</a> - compare MAAS with other instruments
